page.title: 10FARMING,LOCAL GOVT,HEALTH
page.content: FARMING: The grasslands are used for dairy and beef herds together with sheep. Pigs are reared in deep litter.Arable farming includes corn,hay,wheat,maize,barley,turnips, potatoes and greenstuffs.The fishing fleet puts to sea to catch cod,conger, whiting,mullet,plaice,dabs,mackerel and laterly pilchards. LOCAL GOVERNMENT:The Looe Town Council is the authority at grass roots level whilst most services are administered by the Caradon District Council. HEALTH:A new health centre is in the process of being built but all other matters have to be refered to Liskeard or Plymouth.
